function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'c <= 'z'' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'c <= 'z'' always executed?

dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'c <= 'z'' without passing through its header block?

data_dependency: Is variable 'c (line 4)' used after its definition?

liveness: Does variable 'c' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Is this statement not dead: “c='a';while( c <= 'z' ) { printf("%d - %c\n",c,c); c++; }”?
